snippet: Alongside the impressive technology advances of the last two decades, many see a destructive use of software patents corrupting the marketplace for ideas.
abstract: Thousands of American companies are caught in a software patent system that experts say is so flawed that it often stymies innovation; alongside the impressive technological advances of the last two decades, they argue, a pall has descended as the marketplace for new ideas becomes increasingly corrupted by software patents used as destructive weapons (Series: The iEconomy).

byline.original: By CHARLES DUHIGG and STEVE LOHR

lead_paragraph: Alongside the impressive technology advances of the last two decades, many see a destructive use of software patents corrupting the marketplace for ideas.

headline.seo: In Technology Wars, Using the Patent as a Sword
headline.main: The Patent, Used as a Sword
